customer_reviews.text: This stuff is gentler than chlorahexadine sprays, but it is a mild disinfectant (detergent?). It works by suspending an extra electron to the main molecule so when sprayed on bacteria or fungus, the electron jumps ship and destroys the organism's molecules/cell wall. Works in ears, paws, raw skin, nether regions, and for the incessant itchiness of a malassazia infection. I have a large dog and at one bottle per body application, it's WAY overpriced to use for anything other than small, non-chronic spots. Otherwise I'd give it 5 stars.
